text: which sampler do you guys recommend for non-trivial Bayesian differential equation models? i.e. if each diffeq solve takes several seconds or more, is NUTS/HMC still the way to go?

elements.text: which sampler do you guys recommend for non-trivial Bayesian differential equation models? i.e. if each diffeq solve takes several seconds or more, is NUTS/HMC still the way to go?

text: If it's a small (no. of parameters) diff eq you should be able to use MH for faster sampling

elements.text: If it's a small (no. of parameters) diff eq you should be able to use MH for faster sampling

text: it's a big-ish discretized PDE, but I'm looking to start with very few sampled/learned parameters

elements.text: it's a big-ish discretized PDE, but I'm looking to start with very few sampled/learned parameters

text: I figured MH would probably suffice, at least for some parameters that don't need gradients

elements.text: I figured MH would probably suffice, at least for some parameters that don't need gradients

text: Right, makes sense to try out MH first then
